intro: Pelea wawreana, commonly known as the mountain pelea, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Pelea wawreana is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and humid conditions.
